title: mStable ProtocolDAO signer threshold change
body:
It is motioned to lower the signer threshold for ratification and transaction execution in the mStable ProtocolDAO to 4/8 from 5/8. 

This is being done to reduce the friction and difficulty of coordinating signers to ratify and/or execute protocol changes on-chain in a timely manner.

If successfully ratified, this change would apply to the mStable ProtocolDAO entities on ETH mainnet and Polygon/Matic chains along with the snapshot page. This assumes the current open motion regarding the Polygon/Matic entity signer structure ratifies an identical signer structure (option 2 in this [poll](https://snapshot.org/#/mstableprotocoldao.eth/proposal/QmZbhPeLHUYit7i5NMteWdGnRxjG7BFKwUCcd7YZH85mg9)).

This will lower the threshold for transaction execution on chain to 4/8. This will also lower the threshold for motions to be ratified on snapshot to 4/8.

In an edge case scenario where protocolDAO signers are split evenly (4 vs 4) on a contentious issue, the decision will be escalated to a public vMTA vote for resolution.

**Should the mStable ProtocolDAO signer threshold for transaction execution and motion ratification be lowered to 4/8 from 5/8?**
author: 0xD8baE7d96df905E46718B6ceE3410F535e11bF20
